intro: Calyptronoma synanthera, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture, and its inflorescence consists of a single, showy flower surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Calyptronoma synanthera is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil and indirect sunlight.
